titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Marybeth Kavanagh

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-03-01T09:33-0500

did.abstract: This collection consists of 6 color photographs of subway performers taken by Kurt Boone, and two posters advertising a 2017 exhibition of his photos.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Kurt Boone was born in Brooklyn, N.Y. in 1959. The New York City-based author, poet, and messenger is known for his work documenting street culture, including graffiti, urban cycling, street photography, skateboarding, subway busking, and spoken word performance.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The photographs are arranged alphabetically by title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of six 16x20" color photographs of subway performers taken by Kurt Boone circa 2015. In addition, there are two posters advertising a 2017 exhibition of Boone's photographs, Music in the Tunnels, held at Quimby's Bookstore in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
